Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: Job Duties/Scope Of Work WORK SAFE, MAKE A DIFFERENCE, AND BE A PART OF HISTORY WITH THE CPCCO TEAM! At Central Plateau Cleanup Company (CPCCo), located in Richland, Washington, we are working to provide a sustainable future for the historic Hanford area through the protection of the Columbia River and the remediation of the Central Plateau. To achieve our mission, we need exceptionally talented, innovative, and driven people to help us reduce risks on the Hanford Site by removing some of the most hazardous waste streams and facilities in the Department of Energy (DOE) complex. If you would like to work with a highly skilled workforce to achieve unique and challenging goals that critically impact our environment and community, this is your chance to be a part of our legacy! CPCCo Is Looking For a Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer To Join Our Team To Perform The Following Job Duties And Responsibilities: Primarily perform QA surveillances, assessments, audits, and reviews to determine compliance with and effective implementation of the CPCCo QA Program. Develop, review and approve documents and procedures implementing the CPCCo QA Program to assure QA requirements are integrated into project work planning, procurement, and assurance of performance. These are to include commercial grade dedications and product Quality Assurance Inspection Plans. Perform field inspection and oversight of work activities using basic, mechanical and welding level II inspection disciplines. Provide expert QA/QC guidance and problem-solving expertise as requested to resolve and prevent quality problems. Perform contract and contractor oversight activities. Provide QA Engineer support to CPCCo Projects. Basic Qualifications Career Level Grade 18: Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience with 6 or more years of relevant experience Career Level Grade 19: Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience with 8 or more years of relevant experience The higher posted level has greater scope, complexity, authority, impact. The level offered to the selected candidate will be based on the needs of the company and the candidate's education, training, and/or experience. Desired Qualifications Proficient in the use of computer-based procurement and work control systems. Prior experience and knowledge of Commercial Grade Dedication methods. Prior inspection certifications for basic, mechanical and welding. Experience in supporting nuclear facility construction. Experience performing project document reviews, surveillances, and audits. Experience and knowledge of software quality assurance. Compensation & Benefits In accordance with the CPCCo salary determination process, CPCCo takes into consideration the level of assigned job duties and responsibilities, and the candidate's education, training, and/or experience relative to internal peers and the external labor market. CPCCo will not solicit salary history for candidates. Expected annualized pay range based on 40 hours per week: Career Level Grade 18: $92,700 - $148,550 Career Level Grade 19: $101,950 - $163,050 In addition to base pay, employees may be eligible for variable pay awards. CPCCo's generous benefits package offers medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 401(k) employer match and paid time off. For a full list of benefits please see https://cpcco.hanford.gov/page.cfm/Careers. A few perks you can anticipate, depending on the nature of your employment with CPCCo, include the following: A casual-dress work environment, where jeans are a regular thing. A standard 4-10's work schedule that allows for long weekends and recharging on the Columbia River, on a golf course, at 200+ surrounding wineries, or at other Pacific Northwest destinations where fishing, hunting, snowboarding, hiking, and other outdoor sporting opportunities are in abundance. CPCCo is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Relocation Funding Provided No U.S. Citizenship Required Yes Clearance Required No Job Classification Exempt Shift Work Required No CPCCo is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and abides by federal, state, and local statutory requirements, including CFR 41 60-1.4 - Equal Opportunity , CFR 41 60-300.5 - Veterans , CFR 41 60-741.5 - Disabilities , and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 . CPCCo provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and job applicants and prohibits discrimination without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, genetics, marital status, pregnancy status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training, and terms of employment. If you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendment Act (ADAAA) while applying for a position with CPCCo, please e-mail ^CPCCo_EEO . Note: Please do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of an application. If you have any difficulties while applying for a position, please send an email to ^CPCCo Human Resources. Applicants And Employees Have Rights Under Federal Employment Laws And Are Protected Under Federal Law Against Discrimination. To View Information Regarding These Rights, Please Click On These Links: Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal Pay Transparency Policy Statement Family Medical Leave Act Employee Polygraph Protection Act WA State Paid Family Medical Leave Show more Show less

Title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Actalent. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice. Job Title: Software Quality Assurance EngineerJob Description The Software / Hardware Quality Assurance Engineer will be responsible for developing, modifying, applying, and maintaining standards for software and hardware operating methods, processes, systems, and procedures. The engineer will support manufacturing, assembly, integration, configuration management, materials selection, and test activities. Responsibilities Develop and maintain standards for software and hardware operating methods, processes, systems, and procedures. Support manufacturing, assembly, integration, and configuration management activities. Select materials and conduct test activities. Ensure compliance with SW & HW quality assurance standards, including traceability, unit testing, regression testing, static analysis, and materials analysis. Lead the quality team and manage quality assurance projects. Essential Skills Proficiency in hardware and software quality assurance. Understanding of ISO 9001 standards. Experience with AS9100 standards. Knowledge in configuration management. Traceability, unit testing, regression testing, and static analysis experience. Additional Skills & Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering. Experience in a regulated environment such as space or defense is preferred. 2+ years of experience performing PA/QA technical requirements. Work Environment The work environment includes a combination of office and laboratory settings, with 50% of the time spent in the lab. The engineer will work on multiple programs, including those in defense and aerospace sectors such as Artemis and Gateway. There are currently more programs than engineers on staff, providing a dynamic and hands-on experience in quality assurance. Pay and Benefits The pay range for this position is $45.00 - $60.00/hr. Requirements Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits available for this temporary role may include the following: Medical, dental & vision Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents) Short and long-term disability Health Spending Account (HSA) Transportation benefits Employee Assistance Program Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave) Workplace Type This is a fully onsite position in Pasadena,CA. Application Deadline This position is anticipated to close on Jul 22, 2025. About Actalent Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com (%20actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com) for other accommodation options. Title: It Testing & Quality Assurance Analyst (Remote)
Description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Virtua Health. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice. At Virtua Health, we exist for one reason – to better serve you. That means being here for you in all the moments that matter, striving each day to connect you to the care you need. Whether that's wellness and prevention, experienced specialists, life-changing care, or something in-between – we are your partner in health devoted to building a healthier community. If you live or work in South Jersey, exceptional care is all around. Our medical and surgical experts are among the best in the country. We assembled more than 14,000 colleagues, including over 2,850 skilled and compassionate doctors, physician assistants, and nurse practitioners equipped with the latest technologies, treatments, and techniques to provide exceptional care close to home. A Magnet-recognized health system ranked by U.S. News and World Report, we've received multiple awards for quality, safety, and outstanding work environment.In addition to five hospitals, seven emergency departments, seven urgent care centers, and more than 280 other locations (https://www.virtua.org/locations) , we're committed to the well-being of the community. That means bringing life-changing resources and health services directly into our communities through our Eat Well food access program (https://www.virtua.org/about/eat-well) , telehealth, home health, rehabilitation, mobile screenings, paramedic programs, and convenient online scheduling. We're also affiliated with Penn Medicine for cancer and neurosciences, and the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia for pediatrics. Location: Lippincott - 301 Lippincott Drive Employment Type Employee Employment Classification Regular Time Type Full time Work Shift 1st Shift (United States of America) Total Weekly Hours 40 Additional Locations: Job Information This position requires 1-2 days weekly on-site in Marlton, New Jersey. Only applicants within a reasonable commuting distance should apply. Job Summary The IT Testing and Quality Assurance Analyst develops test plans facilitates testing events, and reports on testing and validation outcomes for IT applications and systems to support IT in delivering stable, reliable solutions. They verify and validate that the intended solution meets stated requirements and expected outcomes and that they work as expected. They also serve as the primary liaison between IT and operational teams for all assigned IT testing activities. Position Responsibilities Collaborate with IT Teams to understand the testing and quality assurance application/system requirements. Ensure that validated test scripts, test plans and reports/dashboards meet functional and design specifications, requirements, IT best practices and standards. Leverage established testing methodologies, templates and processes. Facilitates assists and supports IT team members to develop and maintain test scripts and related documentation. Create, document, and maintain IT test plans around new and existing business requirements and technical specifications. Identifies testing equipment, systems, access and environments needed to support testing requirements. Coordinate, conduct and facilitate testing events as required by the application and/or system. IT testing events include application, integrated, regression, smoke, and end-user acceptance testing. Act as liaison between IT and operational teams for IT testing activities. Capture and communicate the results of testing accurately and clearly and participate in applicable meetings. Produce metrics, analysis, and other relevant reporting deliverables and/or dashboards for team, IT Management and Internal Audit, regarding IT QA/ testing results and outcomes. Works with IT leadership and IT Project Managers to support and facilitate IT testing activity schedules, aligning with project milestones. Prepares testing reports and dashboards for the Go/NoGo tollgate. Align with IT PMO standards and best practices. Troubleshoot with IT team to identify, replicate, verify and report defects. Assist team to report and escalate with appropriate tools (i.e. ServiceNow, vendor ticket) and to management. Assist and support IT teams with logging and tracking issues to defect resolution. Proactively analyzes ServiceNow incidents and change requests for assigned application suite, to continuously update and improve the test script library to account for the scenarios that resulted in incidents or change requests. Provide analysis of trends, recommendations, and feedback for improvement of IT testing practices and related processes. Is continuous improvement focused. Position Qualifications Required Required Experience: Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Information Services or related area. Proficient with MS Teams and MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Expertise in multiple healthcare applications is highly recommended. Firm understanding of IT Project lifecycle and IT testing concepts, practice and tools. Experience In Test Requirements, Test Preparation, Execution And Reporting. Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills. Required Education BA/BS in Information Systems or related field required. Combination of relevant education and experience will be considered in lieu of a degree. Annual Salary: $72,992 - $116,601 The actual salary/rate will vary based on applicant’s experience as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. Virtua offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: medical/prescription, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care flexible spending accounts; 403(b) (401(k) subject to collective bargaining agreement); paid time off, paid sick leave as provided under state and local paid sick leave laws, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, colleague and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; tuition assistance, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits is governed by the applicable plan documents and policies. For more benefits information click here (http://view.publitas.com/kelly-1/virtua-benefit-guide-pt-2025/) . Title: Uat Tester
Description: Job Title: UAT Tester Location: Phoenix, AZ Domain: Telecom Experience Level: 6+ Years Note- Fluent in Spanish Language Job Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive UAT Tester to support testing initiatives in the Telecommunications domain. You will be responsible for validating system functionality, network service features, and user flows through User Acceptance Testing across web and mobile platforms (iOS and Android). The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with JIRA, Kibana, SQL, Postman, Q-Test, and mobile application testing in telecom environments. Key Responsibilities: Lead and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure telecom products and services meet user expectations and business requirements. Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and product owners to define test scenarios, acceptance criteria, and sign-off procedures. Log and track defects in JIRA with proper severity, steps to reproduce, and supporting evidence. Validate data accuracy and service provisioning by executing complex SQL queries across telecom databases. Use Postman to test RESTful APIs related to customer data, billing, provisioning, and service activation. Perform mobile testing on telecom apps and services across iOS and Android platforms. Analyze system and service logs via Kibana to troubleshoot backend issues or unexpected behavior. Maintain test cases and execution cycles in Q-Test, ensuring full traceability and coverage. Participate in Agile ceremonies and provide UAT status reports and defect metrics to stakeholders. Required Skills & Experience: Minimum 3 years of experience in UAT testing, preferably within the telecom industry. Proficiency in JIRA for test tracking and defect management. Strong knowledge of SQL for backend data validation. Working experience with Postman for API validation. Experience with Kibana for analyzing system logs and debugging. Hands-on experience using Q-Test or similar test management tools. Expertise in mobile testing on iOS and Android platforms. Understanding of telecom-specific systems (e.g., OSS/BSS, billing, service provisioning) is highly desirable. Strong communication and documentation skills. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or related field. Experience in Agile/Scrum environments. Knowledge of telecom protocols, subscriber management, and network layers is a plus. UAT or ISTQB certification preferred. Show more Show less

Assist team to report and escalate with appropriate tools (i.e. ServiceNow, vendor ticket) and to management. Assist and support IT teams with logging and tracking issues to defect resolution. Proactively analyzes ServiceNow incidents and change requests for assigned application suite, to continuously update and improve the test script library to account for the scenarios that resulted in incidents or change requests. Provide analysis of trends, recommendations, and feedback for improvement of IT testing practices and related processes. Is continuous improvement focused. Position Qualifications Required Required Experience: Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Information Services or related area. Proficient with MS Teams and MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Expertise in multiple healthcare applications is highly recommended. Firm understanding of IT Project lifecycle and IT testing concepts, practice and tools. Experience In Test Requirements, Test Preparation, Execution And Reporting. Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills. Required Education BA/BS in Information Systems or related field required. Combination of relevant education and experience will be considered in lieu of a degree. Annual Salary: $72,992 - $116,601 The actual salary/rate will vary based on applicant’s experience as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. Title: Compliance Testing Analyst
Description: JustinBradley’s client, a leading source of mortgage financing, is seeking a highly skilled Compliance Testing Analyst to join their Risk & Compliance team. This role is responsible for conducting testing of internal controls to ensure adherence to corporate policies, regulatory requirements, and risk management standards. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, a solid understanding of compliance and operational risk principles, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Must be local to Reston, VA or Plano, TX for their on-site requirement. Responsibilities: Conduct control testing activities to evaluate the design and operational effectiveness of internal controls. Lead and facilitate test inquiry meetings with internal control owners and business stakeholders. Review relevant policies, procedures, and job aids to support test planning and execution. Select representative samples of transactions or activities for control testing. Collect, assess, and validate evidence supporting the operation of controls. Prepare comprehensive analysis and document all test results in the system of record (e.g., MetricStream). Track identified control issues through the remediation process and validate closure of corrective actions. Identify and escalate control deficiencies, emerging risks, or non-compliance trends to management in a timely manner. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Risk Management, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in compliance testing, internal audit, operational risk, or a related risk/control function. Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business partners at all levels. High attention to detail and excellent time management skills with the ability to handle multiple testing projects concurrently. Proficient in analyzing complex data, identifying control gaps, and offering practical solutions. Team-oriented with the ability to collaborate across departments to ensure enterprise-wide compliance objectives are met. Experience with compliance management tools (e.g., MetricStream) is a plus. Industry certifications such as CCEP (Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional) or PMP (Project Management Professional) are preferred. JustinBradley is an EO employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected employees. Show more Show less

Title: Iso 20022 Testing Analyst
Description: This contract role focuses on testing and documenting system changes related to the ISO 20022 migration, with a particular emphasis on impacts to sanctions screening and transaction monitoring systems. The position involves UAT coordination, FircoSoft list management, and compliance reporting for head office and model risk approvals. Client Details Our client is the U.S. branch of a leading global financial institution, serving as a key hub for corporate and investment banking operations across the Americas. They operate on a hybrid work schedule, with employees expected to work on-site at their Midtown Manhattan office two days per week, supporting a collaborative and dynamic team environment focused on regulatory compliance, risk management, and technology transformation initiatives. Description Assess system changes related to ISO 20022 and their impact on sanctions screening and transaction monitoring. Coordinate and perform UAT, including test case development and documentation. Prepare reports for head office and model risk management approvals. Manage FircoSoft sanctions list testing and tuning documentation. Support rule creation, list cleanup, and other compliance tuning efforts. Collaborate with compliance, tech, and risk teams on implementation and reporting. Maintain organized testing records and documentation for audit readiness. Profile Bachelor's Degree. 2+ years of relevant experience in compliance systems, UAT testing, or financial crime technology. Working knowledge of ISO 20022 messages, including understanding of wire message structures and transaction flows. Experience with sanctions screening systems, such as FircoSoft (list management, tuning, and daily list updates). Understanding of AML/Transaction Monitoring systems and regulatory compliance frameworks. Hands-on experience with system testing, including developing and executing test scripts, capturing results, and maintaining evidence. Job Offer The offer for the successful ISO 20022 Testing Analyst applicant includes a competitive hourly pay rate and opportunity to work on a hybrid schedule in Midtown New York City for one of the world's largest Financial Institutions for the duration of a 6-month contract. Desired Skills and Experience ISO 20022 FircoSoft AML Transaction Monitoring Sanctions Screening UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Compliance Technology QA Testing MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants. Show more Show less

Title: Software Tester
Description: Job Category: Engineering and Technical Support Time Type: Full time Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None Employee Type: Regular Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10% Type of Travel: Local * * * The Opportunity CACI is seeking a Software Tester for our Mastodon Design team in Rochester, NY! We specialize in designing and building hardware and software to meet our customers’ requirements. We focus on offering devices that can be fielded immediately to meet the mission needs that lie directly ahead. Size, weight, power, and packaging are of paramount importance in everything we design and build. Our expertise allows us to rapidly provide these solutions in specialized electronic/mechanical design, embedded &application-level software, reverse engineering & protocol analysis, and RF signals exploitation and communications systems. Responsibilities Verification and validation of software and hardware products. Conduct PATs for TLS systems. Implement and conducts test and evaluation procedures. Identify system and software problems, record defects and reporting the results of testing. Execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for integration, functional, regression and user acceptance testing. Update existing tests while working with developers testing new software as it is completed. Qualifications Required: 3+ years related work experience in software testing with a focus of regression testing and test development. Ability to obtain and maintain minimally a Secret clearance (US Citizenship required). Experience with functional testing, integration testing, system testing, and user acceptance testing. Ability to create test plans, test procedures, and problem reports. Organized and capable of updating test plans and cases based on problem reports and customer feedback. Experience using Jira, Xray, Confluence, and Testrail. Comfortable working with Linux and windows operating systems. Self-starter who likes working in a team environment Solid interpersonal as well as excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired A strong understanding of RF fundamentals. Former EW/SIGINT system operator. Familiarity with RF tactical communication systems, applications, and wireless networking. ________________________________________________________________________________________ What You Can Expect A culture of integrity. At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation. An environment of trust. CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality. A focus on continuous growth. Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy. Your potential is limitless. So is ours. Learn more about CACI here. ________________________________________________________________________________________ Pay Range : There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here. The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is $57,500-$117,900 CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic. Title: Senior Compliance Testing Analyst
Description: Company : Financial Services/Investment Banking Title : Senior Compliance Analyst Location : Tampa, FL Hours : Business Start : ASAP Job Description Responsible for the coordination and completion of all government, regulatory, and compliance documents for all business units in an organization. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May lead and direct the work of others. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Typically reports to a supervisor or manager. Lead comprehensive control evaluations and substantive testing to independently assess the design and effectiveness of controls within the Corporate Functions organization . Ensure compliance with internal policies, procedures, and external laws, rules, and regulations, while identifying necessary remediation actions. This includes developing and executing testing procedures, meticulously documenting results, drawing informed conclusions, making actionable recommendations, and distributing detailed compliance testing review reports. Requirements 3 to 8 years of experience or equivalent expertise in risk management, assessment, control evaluations, or a related field, preferably within the financial services industry. Strong understanding of industry standards and regulatory requirements, with the ability to stay updated on evolving regulatory landscapes. Testing or audit experience is 100% required. Proven ability to analyze complex issues, develop and implement effective risk mitigation strategies, and communicate insights clearly to senior stakeholders. Proficient knowledge of risk management frameworks, regulations, and industry best practices. Skilled in developing well-founded recommendations based on regulatory guidance, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance requirements. Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a track record of managing multiple priorities and delivering results in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify key risk areas. Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex information clearly to diverse audiences. Preferred Qualifications CISM, CRISC, CISSP, CISA, CCEP, CRCM, CRCMP, GRCP, or other industry-recognized risk and risk certifications preferred. A background in auditing and the ability to understand of internal controls is beneficial. Proficiency in MS (Microsoft Suite) Office - Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of data analytical tools such as Tableau, Altryx or Pythyon is a plus. Title: Qa Software Tester Ll
Description: Summary iFIT’s vision is to create the world's most holistic health and fitness platform, integrating all elements of health - physical fitness, mental health, nutrition and active recovery - into a seamless interactive experience. We develop proprietary software that learns and adjusts to the habits of each person as it delivers immersive content that guides them on their individual fitness journey. We are currently seeking an ambitious pace-setter to join our team as a QA Software Tester in Logan, UT . ROLE COMMITMENTS Contribute to the testing and release of major software initiatives across multiple platforms, including tablet and mobile environments. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support global feature rollouts and region-specific releases. Participate in early-stage testing of new applications and major platform updates, including internal alpha and public beta cycles. Assist in the development and maintenance of comprehensive test cases and test suites for new product features. Help ensure timely delivery and quality assurance of evolving mobile and tablet experiences through iterative testing cycles Key Responsibilities Design, write, and execute test plans, test cases, and test runs for moderately complex features. Identify, log, and clearly communicate defects using tools like JIRA and TestRail. Perform various types of testing including regression, black box, smoke, and interface testing. Analyze test results, document findings, and follow through to issue resolution. Collaborate with developers to isolate bugs and validate fixes. Provide input on test coverage, testability of requirements, and potential risk areas. Raise concerns about ambiguous or conflicting requirements and work with stakeholders to clarify them. Support testing of hardware/software interactions when applicable. Contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes and tools. Show more Show less

That means being here for you in all the moments that matter, striving each day to connect you to the care you need. Whether that's wellness and prevention, experienced specialists, life-changing care, or something in-between – we are your partner in health devoted to building a healthier community. If you live or work in South Jersey, exceptional care is all around. Our medical and surgical experts are among the best in the country. We assembled more than 14,000 colleagues, including over 2,850 skilled and compassionate doctors, physician assistants, and nurse practitioners equipped with the latest technologies, treatments, and techniques to provide exceptional care close to home. A Magnet-recognized health system ranked by U.S. News and World Report, we've received multiple awards for quality, safety, and outstanding work environment.In addition to five hospitals, seven emergency departments, seven urgent care centers, and more than 280 other locations (https://www.virtua.org/locations) , we're committed to the well-being of the community. That means bringing life-changing resources and health services directly into our communities through our Eat Well food access program (https://www.virtua.org/about/eat-well) , telehealth, home health, rehabilitation, mobile screenings, paramedic programs, and convenient online scheduling. We're also affiliated with Penn Medicine for cancer and neurosciences, and the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia for pediatrics. Location: Lippincott - 301 Lippincott Drive Employment Type Employee Employment Classification Regular Time Type Full time Work Shift 1st Shift (United States of America) Total Weekly Hours 40 Additional Locations: Job Information This position requires 1-2 days weekly on-site in Marlton, New Jersey. Only applicants within a reasonable commuting distance should apply. Job Summary The IT Testing and Quality Assurance Analyst develops test plans facilitates testing events, and reports on testing and validation outcomes for IT applications and systems to support IT in delivering stable, reliable solutions. They verify and validate that the intended solution meets stated requirements and expected outcomes and that they work as expected. They also serve as the primary liaison between IT and operational teams for all assigned IT testing activities. Position Responsibilities Collaborate with IT Teams to understand the testing and quality assurance application/system requirements. Ensure that validated test scripts, test plans and reports/dashboards meet functional and design specifications, requirements, IT best practices and standards. Leverage established testing methodologies, templates and processes. Facilitates assists and supports IT team members to develop and maintain test scripts and related documentation. Create, document, and maintain IT test plans around new and existing business requirements and technical specifications. Identifies testing equipment, systems, access and environments needed to support testing requirements. Coordinate, conduct and facilitate testing events as required by the application and/or system. IT testing events include application, integrated, regression, smoke, and end-user acceptance testing. Act as liaison between IT and operational teams for IT testing activities. Capture and communicate the results of testing accurately and clearly and participate in applicable meetings. Produce metrics, analysis, and other relevant reporting deliverables and/or dashboards for team, IT Management and Internal Audit, regarding IT QA/ testing results and outcomes. Works with IT leadership and IT Project Managers to support and facilitate IT testing activity schedules, aligning with project milestones. Prepares testing reports and dashboards for the Go/NoGo tollgate. Align with IT PMO standards and best practices. Troubleshoot with IT team to identify, replicate, verify and report defects. Assist team to report and escalate with appropriate tools (i.e. ServiceNow, vendor ticket) and to management. Assist and support IT teams with logging and tracking issues to defect resolution. Proactively analyzes ServiceNow incidents and change requests for assigned application suite, to continuously update and improve the test script library to account for the scenarios that resulted in incidents or change requests. Provide analysis of trends, recommendations, and feedback for improvement of IT testing practices and related processes. Is continuous improvement focused. Position Qualifications Required Required Experience: Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Information Services or related area. Proficient with MS Teams and MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Expertise in multiple healthcare applications is highly recommended. Firm understanding of IT Project lifecycle and IT testing concepts, practice and tools. Experience In Test Requirements, Test Preparation, Execution And Reporting. Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills. Required Education BA/BS in Information Systems or related field required. Combination of relevant education and experience will be considered in lieu of a degree. Annual Salary: $72,992 - $116,601 The actual salary/rate will vary based on applicant’s experience as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. Title: Software Tester
Description: About Apexon: Apexon is a digital-first technology services firm specializing in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. We have been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.Apexon brings together distinct core competencies – in AI, analytics, app development, cloud, commerce, CX, data, DevOps, IoT, mobile, quality engineering and UX, and our deep expertise in BFSI, healthcare, and life sciences – to help businesses capitalize on the unlimited opportunities digital offers. Our reputation is built on a comprehensive suite of engineering services, a dedication to solving clients’ toughest technology problems, and a commitment to continuous improvement. Backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital, Apexon now has a global presence of 15 offices (and 10 delivery centers) across four continents. We enable #HumanFirstDIGITAL Position Summary The QA engineer role is responsible to manage all aspects of user acceptance testing and the quality assurance lifecycle pertaining to the RxSense. This includes end to end accountability for the testing quality of the user experience through visual inspection and functional testing against established QA principals, methodology and guidelines. This position requires the ability to oversee, manage and report out the status of manual test cases, execution of test scripts and defect remediation. Also, it should require hands on, technical, and functional testing knowledge. Title: Uat Tester
Description: Job Title: UAT Tester Location: Phoenix, AZ Domain: Telecom Experience Level: 6+ Years Note- Fluent in Spanish Language Job Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive UAT Tester to support testing initiatives in the Telecommunications domain. You will be responsible for validating system functionality, network service features, and user flows through User Acceptance Testing across web and mobile platforms (iOS and Android). The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with JIRA, Kibana, SQL, Postman, Q-Test, and mobile application testing in telecom environments. Key Responsibilities: Lead and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure telecom products and services meet user expectations and business requirements. Collaborate with business analysts, developers, and product owners to define test scenarios, acceptance criteria, and sign-off procedures. Log and track defects in JIRA with proper severity, steps to reproduce, and supporting evidence. Validate data accuracy and service provisioning by executing complex SQL queries across telecom databases. Use Postman to test RESTful APIs related to customer data, billing, provisioning, and service activation. Perform mobile testing on telecom apps and services across iOS and Android platforms. Analyze system and service logs via Kibana to troubleshoot backend issues or unexpected behavior. Maintain test cases and execution cycles in Q-Test, ensuring full traceability and coverage. Participate in Agile ceremonies and provide UAT status reports and defect metrics to stakeholders. Required Skills & Experience: Minimum 3 years of experience in UAT testing, preferably within the telecom industry. Proficiency in JIRA for test tracking and defect management. Strong knowledge of SQL for backend data validation. Working experience with Postman for API validation. Experience with Kibana for analyzing system logs and debugging. Hands-on experience using Q-Test or similar test management tools. Expertise in mobile testing on iOS and Android platforms. Understanding of telecom-specific systems (e.g., OSS/BSS, billing, service provisioning) is highly desirable. Strong communication and documentation skills. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or related field. Experience in Agile/Scrum environments. Knowledge of telecom protocols, subscriber management, and network layers is a plus. UAT or ISTQB certification preferred. Show more Show less

Title: It Testing & Quality Assurance Analyst (Remote)
Description: At Virtua Health, we exist for one reason – to better serve you. That means being here for you in all the moments that matter, striving each day to connect you to the care you need. Whether that's wellness and prevention, experienced specialists, life-changing care, or something in-between – we are your partner in health devoted to building a healthier community. If you live or work in South Jersey, exceptional care is all around. Our medical and surgical experts are among the best in the country. We assembled more than 14,000 colleagues, including over 2,850 skilled and compassionate doctors, physician assistants, and nurse practitioners equipped with the latest technologies, treatments, and techniques to provide exceptional care close to home. A Magnet-recognized health system ranked by U.S. News and World Report, we've received multiple awards for quality, safety, and outstanding work environment. In addition to five hospitals, seven emergency departments, seven urgent care centers, and more than 280 other locations, we're committed to the well-being of the community. That means bringing life-changing resources and health services directly into our communities through our Eat Well food access program, telehealth, home health, rehabilitation, mobile screenings, paramedic programs, and convenient online scheduling. We're also affiliated with Penn Medicine for cancer and neurosciences, and the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia for pediatrics. Location: Lippincott - 301 Lippincott Drive Employment Type Employee Employment Classification Regular Time Type Full time Work Shift 1st Shift (United States of America) Total Weekly Hours 40 Additional Locations: Job Information This position requires 1-2 days weekly on-site in Marlton, New Jersey. Only applicants within a reasonable commuting distance should apply. Job Summary The IT Testing and Quality Assurance Analyst develops test plans facilitates testing events, and reports on testing and validation outcomes for IT applications and systems to support IT in delivering stable, reliable solutions. They verify and validate that the intended solution meets stated requirements and expected outcomes and that they work as expected. They also serve as the primary liaison between IT and operational teams for all assigned IT testing activities. Position Responsibilities Collaborate with IT Teams to understand the testing and quality assurance application/system requirements. Ensure that validated test scripts, test plans and reports/dashboards meet functional and design specifications, requirements, IT best practices and standards. Leverage established testing methodologies, templates and processes. Facilitates assists and supports IT team members to develop and maintain test scripts and related documentation. Create, document, and maintain IT test plans around new and existing business requirements and technical specifications. Identifies testing equipment, systems, access and environments needed to support testing requirements. Coordinate, conduct and facilitate testing events as required by the application and/or system. IT testing events include application, integrated, regression, smoke, and end-user acceptance testing. Act as liaison between IT and operational teams for IT testing activities. Capture and communicate the results of testing accurately and clearly and participate in applicable meetings. Produce metrics, analysis, and other relevant reporting deliverables and/or dashboards for team, IT Management and Internal Audit, regarding IT QA/ testing results and outcomes. Works with IT leadership and IT Project Managers to support and facilitate IT testing activity schedules, aligning with project milestones. Prepares testing reports and dashboards for the Go/NoGo tollgate. Align with IT PMO standards and best practices. Troubleshoot with IT team to identify, replicate, verify and report defects. Assist team to report and escalate with appropriate tools (i.e. ServiceNow, vendor ticket) and to management. Assist and support IT teams with logging and tracking issues to defect resolution. Proactively analyzes ServiceNow incidents and change requests for assigned application suite, to continuously update and improve the test script library to account for the scenarios that resulted in incidents or change requests. Provide analysis of trends, recommendations, and feedback for improvement of IT testing practices and related processes. Is continuous improvement focused. Position Qualifications Required Required Experience: Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Information Services or related area. Proficient with MS Teams and MS Office applications, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint. Expertise in multiple healthcare applications is highly recommended. Firm understanding of IT Project lifecycle and IT testing concepts, practice and tools. Experience In Test Requirements, Test Preparation, Execution And Reporting. Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills. Required Education BA/BS in Information Systems or related field required. Combination of relevant education and experience will be considered in lieu of a degree. Annual Salary: $72,992 - $116,601 The actual salary/rate will vary based on applicant’s experience as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. Virtua offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: medical/prescription, dental and vision insurance; health and dependent care flexible spending accounts; 403(b) (401(k) subject to collective bargaining agreement); paid time off, paid sick leave as provided under state and local paid sick leave laws, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, colleague and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; tuition assistance, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits is governed by the applicable plan documents and policies. For more benefits information click here. Show more Show less

Title: Compliance Testing Analyst
Description: JustinBradley’s client, a leading source of mortgage financing, is seeking a highly skilled Compliance Testing Analyst to join their Risk & Compliance team. This role is responsible for conducting testing of internal controls to ensure adherence to corporate policies, regulatory requirements, and risk management standards. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, a solid understanding of compliance and operational risk principles, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Must be local to Reston, VA or Plano, TX for their on-site requirement. Responsibilities: Conduct control testing activities to evaluate the design and operational effectiveness of internal controls. Lead and facilitate test inquiry meetings with internal control owners and business stakeholders. Review relevant policies, procedures, and job aids to support test planning and execution. Select representative samples of transactions or activities for control testing. Collect, assess, and validate evidence supporting the operation of controls. Prepare comprehensive analysis and document all test results in the system of record (e.g., MetricStream). Track identified control issues through the remediation process and validate closure of corrective actions. Identify and escalate control deficiencies, emerging risks, or non-compliance trends to management in a timely manner. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Risk Management, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in compliance testing, internal audit, operational risk, or a related risk/control function. Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with business partners at all levels. High attention to detail and excellent time management skills with the ability to handle multiple testing projects concurrently. Proficient in analyzing complex data, identifying control gaps, and offering practical solutions. Team-oriented with the ability to collaborate across departments to ensure enterprise-wide compliance objectives are met. Experience with compliance management tools (e.g., MetricStream) is a plus. Industry certifications such as CCEP (Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional) or PMP (Project Management Professional) are preferred. JustinBradley is an EO employer - Veterans/Disabled and other protected employees. Show more Show less

Title: Iso 20022 Testing Analyst
Description: This contract role focuses on testing and documenting system changes related to the ISO 20022 migration, with a particular emphasis on impacts to sanctions screening and transaction monitoring systems. The position involves UAT coordination, FircoSoft list management, and compliance reporting for head office and model risk approvals. Client Details Our client is the U.S. branch of a leading global financial institution, serving as a key hub for corporate and investment banking operations across the Americas. They operate on a hybrid work schedule, with employees expected to work on-site at their Midtown Manhattan office two days per week, supporting a collaborative and dynamic team environment focused on regulatory compliance, risk management, and technology transformation initiatives. Description Assess system changes related to ISO 20022 and their impact on sanctions screening and transaction monitoring. Coordinate and perform UAT, including test case development and documentation. Prepare reports for head office and model risk management approvals. Manage FircoSoft sanctions list testing and tuning documentation. Support rule creation, list cleanup, and other compliance tuning efforts. Collaborate with compliance, tech, and risk teams on implementation and reporting. Maintain organized testing records and documentation for audit readiness. Profile Bachelor's Degree. 2+ years of relevant experience in compliance systems, UAT testing, or financial crime technology. Working knowledge of ISO 20022 messages, including understanding of wire message structures and transaction flows. Experience with sanctions screening systems, such as FircoSoft (list management, tuning, and daily list updates). Understanding of AML/Transaction Monitoring systems and regulatory compliance frameworks. Hands-on experience with system testing, including developing and executing test scripts, capturing results, and maintaining evidence. Job Offer The offer for the successful ISO 20022 Testing Analyst applicant includes a competitive hourly pay rate and opportunity to work on a hybrid schedule in Midtown New York City for one of the world's largest Financial Institutions for the duration of a 6-month contract. Desired Skills and Experience ISO 20022 FircoSoft AML Transaction Monitoring Sanctions Screening UAT (User Acceptance Testing) Compliance Technology QA Testing MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants. Show more Show less

Title: Software Tester
Description: Job Category: Engineering and Technical Support Time Type: Full time Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None Employee Type: Regular Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10% Type of Travel: Local * * * The Opportunity CACI is seeking a Software Tester for our Mastodon Design team in Rochester, NY! We specialize in designing and building hardware and software to meet our customers’ requirements. We focus on offering devices that can be fielded immediately to meet the mission needs that lie directly ahead. Size, weight, power, and packaging are of paramount importance in everything we design and build. Our expertise allows us to rapidly provide these solutions in specialized electronic/mechanical design, embedded &application-level software, reverse engineering & protocol analysis, and RF signals exploitation and communications systems. Responsibilities Verification and validation of software and hardware products. Conduct PATs for TLS systems. Implement and conducts test and evaluation procedures. Identify system and software problems, record defects and reporting the results of testing. Execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for integration, functional, regression and user acceptance testing. Update existing tests while working with developers testing new software as it is completed. Qualifications Required: 3+ years related work experience in software testing with a focus of regression testing and test development. Ability to obtain and maintain minimally a Secret clearance (US Citizenship required). Experience with functional testing, integration testing, system testing, and user acceptance testing. Ability to create test plans, test procedures, and problem reports. Organized and capable of updating test plans and cases based on problem reports and customer feedback. Experience using Jira, Xray, Confluence, and Testrail. Comfortable working with Linux and windows operating systems. Self-starter who likes working in a team environment Solid interpersonal as well as excellent oral and written communication skills. Desired A strong understanding of RF fundamentals. Former EW/SIGINT system operator. Familiarity with RF tactical communication systems, applications, and wireless networking. ________________________________________________________________________________________ What You Can Expect A culture of integrity. At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation. An environment of trust. CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality. A focus on continuous growth. Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy. Your potential is limitless. So is ours. Learn more about CACI here. ________________________________________________________________________________________ Pay Range : There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here. The Proposed Salary Range For This Position Is $57,500-$117,900 CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic. Title: Senior Compliance Testing Analyst
Description: Company : Financial Services/Investment Banking Title : Senior Compliance Analyst Location : Tampa, FL Hours : Business Start : ASAP Job Description Responsible for the coordination and completion of all government, regulatory, and compliance documents for all business units in an organization. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. May lead and direct the work of others. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Typically reports to a supervisor or manager. Lead comprehensive control evaluations and substantive testing to independently assess the design and effectiveness of controls within the Corporate Functions organization . Ensure compliance with internal policies, procedures, and external laws, rules, and regulations, while identifying necessary remediation actions. This includes developing and executing testing procedures, meticulously documenting results, drawing informed conclusions, making actionable recommendations, and distributing detailed compliance testing review reports. Requirements 3 to 8 years of experience or equivalent expertise in risk management, assessment, control evaluations, or a related field, preferably within the financial services industry. Strong understanding of industry standards and regulatory requirements, with the ability to stay updated on evolving regulatory landscapes. Testing or audit experience is 100% required. Proven ability to analyze complex issues, develop and implement effective risk mitigation strategies, and communicate insights clearly to senior stakeholders. Proficient knowledge of risk management frameworks, regulations, and industry best practices. Skilled in developing well-founded recommendations based on regulatory guidance, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and compliance requirements. Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a track record of managing multiple priorities and delivering results in a fast-paced environment. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify key risk areas. Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying complex information clearly to diverse audiences. Preferred Qualifications CISM, CRISC, CISSP, CISA, CCEP, CRCM, CRCMP, GRCP, or other industry-recognized risk and risk certifications preferred. A background in auditing and the ability to understand of internal controls is beneficial. Proficiency in MS (Microsoft Suite) Office - Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of data analytical tools such as Tableau, Altryx or Pythyon is a plus. Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status. Title: Qa Software Tester Ll
Description: Summary iFIT’s vision is to create the world's most holistic health and fitness platform, integrating all elements of health - physical fitness, mental health, nutrition and active recovery - into a seamless interactive experience. We develop proprietary software that learns and adjusts to the habits of each person as it delivers immersive content that guides them on their individual fitness journey. We are currently seeking an ambitious pace-setter to join our team as a QA Software Tester in Logan, UT . ROLE COMMITMENTS Contribute to the testing and release of major software initiatives across multiple platforms, including tablet and mobile environments. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support global feature rollouts and region-specific releases. Participate in early-stage testing of new applications and major platform updates, including internal alpha and public beta cycles. Assist in the development and maintenance of comprehensive test cases and test suites for new product features. Help ensure timely delivery and quality assurance of evolving mobile and tablet experiences through iterative testing cycles Key Responsibilities Design, write, and execute test plans, test cases, and test runs for moderately complex features. Identify, log, and clearly communicate defects using tools like JIRA and TestRail. Perform various types of testing including regression, black box, smoke, and interface testing. Analyze test results, document findings, and follow through to issue resolution. Collaborate with developers to isolate bugs and validate fixes. Provide input on test coverage, testability of requirements, and potential risk areas. Raise concerns about ambiguous or conflicting requirements and work with stakeholders to clarify them. Support testing of hardware/software interactions when applicable. Contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes and tools. Show more Show less

Title: Associate Qa Tester
Description: Unfortunately, the Associate QA Tester is not able to provide sponsorship now or anytime in the future.*** This role requires you to be located in the Indianapolis area because this is a hybrid role and requires one a day a week in the office.*** Position Summary This role is responsible for quality deliverables of Precision AQ products and client projects on the Product Solutions team. This position interacts with application development teams, product owners, data analysts, client engagement teams, and other business stakeholders to ensure the delivery of high-quality products to meet our clients’ business needs. This position is accountable for executing manual test cases largely based on comparing Legally Reviewed (MLR) approved documentation to software output where detailed accuracy is critical. The Associate QA Tester role is heavily focused on proof-reading skills and applies meticulous inspection to ensure quality. The Tester detects and reports defects and inconsistencies while adhering to deadlines and milestones established by the project teams. Essential functions of the job include but are not limited to: Collaborate with the Precision AQ team stakeholders to review user stories, requirements and client documentation to ensure understanding and testability. Execute testing of development output against mark-up and legally approved submissions for overall quality including proofreading content for spelling, grammar, and formatting. Execute manual test cases and document results. Detect and track defects in accordance with team standards, re-testing to ensure a proper resolution has been implemented. Effectively manage multiple projects concurrently with shifting priorities. Adhere to project milestones as defined by the project teams. Report status, concerns, and risks for client deliverables including applications, reports, and data files. Develop understanding of manage markets, payer data and Precision products to improve effectiveness in quality capabilities. Qualifications Minimum Required: Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent desired You must have a strong capability for syntax, typos, and grammar Exceptional proofreading skills and attention to detail Familiarity with Microsoft Office products such as Excel Skills Attention to detail, accuracy, and quality Ability to adapt to changing priorities Ability to work independently and as part of a team Analytical mindset with good problem-solving skills Ability to create and foster relationships within a team-oriented, collaborative environment Excellent communication skills through multiple media Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new business processes and technologies Preferred Experience with application life cycle and manual testing tools such as Azure DevOps is a plus General knowledge of computer systems, software, web browsers and web-based applications Understanding of software quality terminology and its application Experience testing with mobile devices (specifically iPads) is a plus Precision is required by law in some states or cities to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Precision, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. This role is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, health insurance, retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, and paid time off for sick leave and vacation, among other benefits. Reasonable estimate of the current range $42,400 - $63,600 USD Any data provided as a part of this application will be stored in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For CA applicants, please also refer to our CA Privacy Notice. Precision Medicine Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Essential functions of the job include but are not limited to: Collaborate with the Precision AQ team stakeholders to review user stories, requirements and client documentation to ensure understanding and testability. Execute testing of development output against mark-up and legally approved submissions for overall quality including proofreading content for spelling, grammar, and formatting. Execute manual test cases and document results. Detect and track defects in accordance with team standards, re-testing to ensure a proper resolution has been implemented. Effectively manage multiple projects concurrently with shifting priorities. Adhere to project milestones as defined by the project teams. Report status, concerns, and risks for client deliverables including applications, reports, and data files. Develop understanding of manage markets, payer data and Precision products to improve effectiveness in quality capabilities. Qualifications Minimum Required: Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent desired You must have a strong capability for syntax, typos, and grammar Exceptional proofreading skills and attention to detail Familiarity with Microsoft Office products such as Excel Skills Attention to detail, accuracy, and quality Ability to adapt to changing priorities Ability to work independently and as part of a team Analytical mindset with good problem-solving skills Ability to create and foster relationships within a team-oriented, collaborative environment Excellent communication skills through multiple media Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new business processes and technologies Preferred Experience with application life cycle and manual testing tools such as Azure DevOps is a plus General knowledge of computer systems, software, web browsers and web-based applications Understanding of software quality terminology and its application Experience testing with mobile devices (specifically iPads) is a plus Precision is required by law in some states or cities to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. Title: Software Tester
Company: Hs - Hamburger Software Gmbh & Co. Kg
Description: Als Mitglied der Qualitätssicherung arbeitest du gemeinsam mit unserem Webentwicklungsteam daran, unsere neue Produktgeneration aufzubauen. In deiner Rolle als Softwaretester (m/w/d) stellst du die fehlerfreie Anwendung unserer neuen cloudbasierten Produkte sicher. Unser Produktmanagement und die Entwicklung unterstützt du zudem bei der Umsetzung neuer Anforderungen. DEINE AUFGABEN Die Durchführung der inhaltlichen und funktionalen Produkttests unserer cloudbasierten Softwarelösungen liegt in deiner Verantwortung Du erstellst Testfälle, führst diese aus und dokumentierst die Ergebnisse Du bewertest die Abläufe und Benutzungsfreundlichkeit der Software aus Sicht der Anwendenden und unterstützt unser Produktmanagement in der Erstellung von User Stories An der Konzeption und dem Testdesign wirkst du mit Dabei arbeitest du eng mit deinen Teammitgliedern in der Qualitätssicherung und dem Softwareentwicklungsteam zusammen DEIN PROFIL Du hast eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation im betriebswirtschaftlichen Bereich Erfahrungen in der Qualitätssicherung und der cloudbasierten Softwaretestung konntest du bereits sammeln Du besitzt ausgezeichnete IT-Kenntnisse und ein hohes technisches Verständnis Als Teamplayer (m/w/d) hast du Spaß am Austausch mit verschiedenen Unternehmensbereichen Du verfügst über eine selbstständige und sorgfältige Arbeitsweise, und bist mit dem agilen Arbeiten wie Scrum oder Kanban vertaut Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Testautomatisierungs-Frameworks sind vorteilhaft ÜBER UNS 1979 gegründet zählt HS – Hamburger Software mit rund 180 Mitarbeitern heute zu den führenden deutschen Herstellern betriebswirtschaftlicher Software mit ausgezeichnetem Kundenservice im Bereich Finanzbuchhaltung, Lohnabrechnung, Personalmanagement und Warenwirtschaft. Show more Show less

Title: Qa-Engineer
Description: Dein nächster Karriereschritt – wir machen es einfach für Dich! Du suchst eine neue Herausforderung und möchtest Dich beruflich weiterentwickeln? Wir schätzen Deine Erfahrung und matchen Deine Expertise mit spannenden Projekten in unterschiedlichen Branchen. Mit unserem unkomplizierten Bewerbungsverfahren findest Du schnell die richtige Chance für Dich. Lass uns gemeinsam Deinen nächsten Schritt gestalten – professionell und passgenau! Das erwartet Dich bei uns: Ein Job mit Zukunft: Dein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag gibt Dir Sicherheit und langfristige Perspektiven. Mehr Zeit für dich: 32 Tage Urlaub im Jahr – denn der 24.12. und der 31.12. sind bei uns Betriebsferien, damit Du die Feiertage stressfrei genießen kannst. Flexibles Arbeiten: Ob im Büro oder mobil – wenn es das Projekt erlaubt, entscheidest Du, wo Du am produktivsten bist. Vorsorge leicht gemacht: Mit unserer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge und den vermögenswirksamen Leistungen investieren wir gemeinsam in Deine Zukunft. Shopping und mehr: Profitiere von exklusiven Vergünstigungen bei unseren Corporate Benefits-Partnern – da ist für jeden etwas dabei. Familienfreundliche Unterstützung: Wir übernehmen einen Teil der Kosten für die Kita, damit Du Beruf und Familie noch besser vereinbaren kannst. Das erwartet Dich bei uns: Du planst und führst Systemtests durch – von der Integration bis zur Qualifizierung – und sorgst dafür, dass neue Features zuverlässig und stabil laufen. Du analysierst Bugs und Abweichungen, bewertest ihre Auswirkungen und bringst strukturiert Klarheit in die Fehlerdokumentation. Du bereitest Testergebnisse professionell auf, erstellst Reports und sorgst so für Transparenz gegenüber dem Team und dem Management. Du entwickelst neue Testmethoden oder passt bestehende an – gerne auch im Austausch mit externen Partnern oder Prüflaboren. Du begleitest Zertifizierungsprozesse und sorgst dafür, dass unsere Lösungen den offiziellen Standards entsprechen. Du arbeitest kontinuierlich an der Optimierung unserer Testlandschaft, verbesserst Tools und Prozesse und hältst dabei unsere Qualitätsstandards hoch.
