Title: Associate Qa Tester
Description: Unfortunately, the Associate QA Tester is not able to provide sponsorship now or anytime in the future.*** This role requires you to be located in the Indianapolis area because this is a hybrid role and requires one a day a week in the office.*** Position Summary This role is responsible for quality deliverables of Precision AQ products and client projects on the Product Solutions team. This position interacts with application development teams, product owners, data analysts, client engagement teams, and other business stakeholders to ensure the delivery of high-quality products to meet our clients’ business needs. This position is accountable for executing manual test cases largely based on comparing Legally Reviewed (MLR) approved documentation to software output where detailed accuracy is critical. The Associate QA Tester role is heavily focused on proof-reading skills and applies meticulous inspection to ensure quality. The Tester detects and reports defects and inconsistencies while adhering to deadlines and milestones established by the project teams. Essential functions of the job include but are not limited to: Collaborate with the Precision AQ team stakeholders to review user stories, requirements and client documentation to ensure understanding and testability. Execute testing of development output against mark-up and legally approved submissions for overall quality including proofreading content for spelling, grammar, and formatting. Execute manual test cases and document results. Detect and track defects in accordance with team standards, re-testing to ensure a proper resolution has been implemented. Effectively manage multiple projects concurrently with shifting priorities. Adhere to project milestones as defined by the project teams. Report status, concerns, and risks for client deliverables including applications, reports, and data files. Develop understanding of manage markets, payer data and Precision products to improve effectiveness in quality capabilities. Qualifications Minimum Required: Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent desired You must have a strong capability for syntax, typos, and grammar Exceptional proofreading skills and attention to detail Familiarity with Microsoft Office products such as Excel Skills Attention to detail, accuracy, and quality Ability to adapt to changing priorities Ability to work independently and as part of a team Analytical mindset with good problem-solving skills Ability to create and foster relationships within a team-oriented, collaborative environment Excellent communication skills through multiple media Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new business processes and technologies Preferred Experience with application life cycle and manual testing tools such as Azure DevOps is a plus General knowledge of computer systems, software, web browsers and web-based applications Understanding of software quality terminology and its application Experience testing with mobile devices (specifically iPads) is a plus Precision is required by law in some states or cities to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Precision, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. This role is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, health insurance, retirement savings benefits, life insurance and disability benefits, parental leave, and paid time off for sick leave and vacation, among other benefits. Reasonable estimate of the current range $42,400 - $63,600 USD Any data provided as a part of this application will be stored in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For CA applicants, please also refer to our CA Privacy Notice. Precision Medicine Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Title: Sr. Manual Qa Tester
Description: Job Description The Manual QA Tester has a critical role in verifying the data integrity within an enterprise system conversion project. Large volumes of data will migrate from a legacy system onto a new platform. The candidate must be a self-starter who can work from various levels of requirements to craft test plans and cases that ensure coverage of all the business system flows. By actively participating in planning and status meetings along with team chat, communication throughout the process is vital to ensure project cadence. Regular updates (typically daily) are required to keep impacted teams moving forward together in this complex series of activities. Routinely working with developers, business systems analysts, other QA testers and stakeholders, the candidate must be able to have clear and concise communications. Must be able to develop, document and maintain large complex data sets to fully exercise the end-to-end testing along with integration and system level testing. Key Responsibilities Performing manual verification and validation of large volumes of data at rest and in transit through the systems under test. Documenting test cases and tracking outcomes from test execution with company approved testing tools. Ability to manage your own workload, prioritize and deliver reliably. Report defects and follow-up through fixes and closure using Azure DevOps. Create SQL queries for a variety of databases to manage test data and verify program outputs. Adapt to changing timelines and business needs while ensuring the highest level of data accuracy at all stages of the migration. Collaborate in a cross-functional team environment. Be comfortable working with systems without a user interface. Much of the work is done by running/scheduling jobs, checking logs, executing APIs with Insomnia, or similar. There is minimal UI checking with the end-user interfaces. Problem solver, analytical thinker, strong attention to detail. Participate in off-hour production releases in a support capacity. Job Requirements Must Have Strong willingness and ability to learn and take initiative Proficiency working with Windows operating systems Experience in database testing Mid-to-high level SQL proficiency Mid-to-high level Excel skills Experience working with a programmatic IDE Nice To Have Financial industry experience, particularly in collections, commercial loans, credit cards, and Installment loans. Familiarity with Python code (reading and modifying existing code; this is not a development role) Experience with file transfer testing Experience using Visual Studio Code Ideal Candidate Traits Self-starter with the ability to work independently Proactive and takes initiative Team-oriented and collaborative Strong analytical thinker with a problem-solving mindset and curiosity New Team Members Can Expect Reference Materials: Access to documentation, artifacts, and a team-maintained wiki for research and context. Support System: An active Business Systems Analyst (BSA) available for guidance and questions. Historical Insight: Team members provide context and guidance on past decisions and project history. Training Approach: A blend of side-by-side training, self-paced learning, and shadowing opportunities. Empowered Learning: "Spread your wings and fly. If you stumble, the team is there." We believe in giving you the freedom to find your path while offering a strong safety net. Fail Forward: Mistakes are part of growth. You're encouraged to try, learn, and improve with the team's support. Mindset for Success Come ready to propose solutions , not just present problems. We value initiative, critical thinking, and collaboration. Show more Show less

Title: Tester
Description: Summary Under direct supervision or using test procedures performs routine tests to determine defective PC assemblies, PROMS and electro-mechanical assemblies and sub-assemblies Essential Job Duties Performs operational tests on PC assemblies, PROMS, and electro-mechanical assemblies and sub-assemblies in accordance with test procedures to determine good product, (accept/not accept). Completes appropriate paperwork as required. Performs routine troubleshooting limited to determination of faults prompted by the test system, visual examination and failure symptoms. Can, with the aid of microscopes, schematics and multi-meters, detect and repair etch shorts between nodes on a printed circuit board. Programs and verifies PROMS. Can perform duties of lower labor grade electronics personnel. Required Qualifications - Required qualifications to effectively perform the job. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience will be considered. (Additional requirements may be designated by position.) Needs to have High School diploma or GED. Trade School education or equivalent work experience. 1 to 3 years' experience in electronics preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities - May be representative, but not all-inclusive, of those knowledge, skills and abilities commonly associated with this position. Critical thinker with exceptional attention to detail. Good communication skills, both verbally and in writing. Ability to utilize test procedures to test and determine product functionality. Ability to develop and maintain positive and productive business relationships. Have a basic understanding of electronics. Work Environment General factory conditions. Exposed to moderate noise levels. The typical schedule is weekdays 7:00 am - 3:30 Must be able to don PPE including safety shoes, or glasses where required in the on-site manufacturing areas. Physical Abilities - Activities that are commonly associated with the performance of the functions of this job. The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Required to use close vision and be able to focus. Regularly required to talk and hear; frequently required to sit, stand, and bend at the knee and waist, and walk. Able to stand for long stretches while testing product. Continuous mental and or visual attention where the flow of work is repetitive, or the operation requires constant alertness. Must be able to have repetitive wrist, hand and/or finger movement to type and work on computer. Must have finger dexterity and hand-eye coordination to work on machinery, computer, telephone, and related office equipment. Regular attendance is a necessary and essential function. Title: Junior Quality Assurance Tester
Description: A QA Tester plays a vital role in supporting the AHS IT team's quality assurance initiatives. Collaborating closely with the team lead and fellow analysts, they ensure their work aligns with team standards while nurturing their professional development. Occasional travel may be required to monitor client and customer interactions and observe call center operations. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Adhering to company and project standards and guidelines. Analyzing requirements and acceptance criteria. Prepare comprehensive and detailed test cases in collaboration with the team. Executing test cases to verify software functionality. Logging defects with clear and informative details for developers to reproduce and resolve. Conducting functional, system, and regression testing. Providing accurate work estimates for assigned tasks. Supporting the development team in staging test data as needed. Actively contributing to the improvement of QA processes and practices. Collaborating with peers to enhance testing efficiency and coverage. KNOWLEDGE SPECIFICATIONS: Associate’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or relevant experience). Title: Quality Assurance Tester
Description: At Rezilient Health, we're not telehealth and we're not your typical doctor's office — we're the best of both worlds, redefining how primary care is delivered. To make that vision possible, our engineering team builds and maintains the custom tools that power our care model. Our technology is mission-critical, and we take pride in supporting a fast-evolving operation that serves real people with real health needs. As a Quality Assurance Tester, you will be the connection between product development and the rest of the organization. You'll work closely with Engineering, Clinical Operations, and Customer Success teams to ensure our product ecosystem is clearly documented, well-understood, and continuously improving. You'll play a central role in maintaining internal knowledge systems, fielding and prioritizing feedback, and helping the team implement product enhancements efficiently and transparently. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of product, process, and people. You are highly organized, proactive, and an excellent communicator. You love building systems that bring structure to complexity. You're energized by the opportunity to wear many hats, take ownership of your work, and help teams function more effectively through process improvement and thoughtful documentation. Requirements Key Responsibilities Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication Act as the primary liaison between the Engineering team and other departments (Clinical, Sales, Operations), ensuring seamless communication on product updates, issues, and feature releases Translate technical concepts and product changes into accessible language and formats for non-technical stakeholders Documentation & Training Develop and maintain comprehensive internal documentation (e.g., FAQs, step-by-step guides, onboarding materials) and training videos for internal teams using our custom software, EMR, and operational tools Create and manage external-facing product documentation and self-help resources (e.g., support articles, video walk-throughs, troubleshooting guides) Draft and publish release notes, product feature summaries, and "what's new" videos to support internal product launches and updates Product Operations & Process Management Implement and maintain streamlined systems for bug tracking, feature suggestion intake, and issue resolution; ensure timely triage and follow-through with the Engineering team Develop workflows and tools to prioritize, define, and route feature requests from across the organization Own and update the internal product feature matrix, including a detailed breakdown of features, user permissions, and access by role type Maintain clinical workflow diagrams in collaboration with the Clinical team, and identify opportunities to optimize processes via technology Quality Assurance & Compliance Coordinate and execute QA testing for new releases, ensuring functionality, usability, and adherence to security and compliance standards Maintain dashboards and documentation pertaining to engineering and IT compliance, including task tracking, remediation status, and audits Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience in Product Operations, Health Tech, or Engineering Support Highly organized, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for process optimization Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, startup environment Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Experience producing clear and engaging content for diverse audiences Comfortable working with minimal structure and shaping new systems from the ground up Familiarity with modern workflow and documentation tools including: Google Workspace, Lucidchart, Miro, Notion, Jira, and Zapier. Experience working in a clinical or health tech environment Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, SOC 2, etc.) Prior experience in QA testing or technical documentation Familiarity with EMR systems or healthcare operations workflows Benefits This opportunity offers the chance to shape the future of healthcare in a culture where your ideas and contributions have a meaningful impact on the organization's future. You'll be part of a supportive, collaborative, and diverse team, with competitive compensation and benefits that include generous PTO, paid family leave, comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, as well as stock options. Title: Sql Qa Analyst
Description: I would like to bring in a manual SQL tester. ( Mid-level experience really good in SQL) for my team to validate our DW migration. This person should compare the Datawarehouse migration we are doing to Databricks compare tables against old DW and new DW. Validate for counts, accuracy and set alerts and create some simple dashboard in Databricks. if there are discrepancies need to reach out to the Data Engineers and tell what's missing. At this time, we are not planning to make a contract to hire but it might change. I can tell for 6 months and maybe another 2-3 months until we finish DW migration. We are looking for Mid-Level SQL QA Analyst to check and validate Data Warehouse Migration and Replication process to Databricks. We are in Process of Migrating the Datawarehouse from Azure SQL Server to Databricks likewise replicating real time our Transactional Data to Databricks. We are expecting both projects to be completed early next year. The Quality Analyst should validate the Dimensions, Fact Tables in Databricks comparing against similar Dimension and Fact Tables in Current SQL Warehouse (Azure SQL). We already migrated a few dimension and fact tables. This person should write test cases, compare the quality, accuracy and validate data between old data warehouse and new data warehouse. For example, comparing the old Fact Sales order against the new Fact Sales order and make sure all the orders are there , all order lines available, order line quantities, cost are all good. Since the old Data Warehouse is currently used in Power BI and other reporting sources that's going to be the metric or authorization we will be using to compare the accuracy of our new Data Warehouse. Also create some alerts in Databricks to automate this process and if there are discrepancies have to validate and find the discrepancy and let Data Engineers know so they can figure out and fix the issue. The validation has to be done daily for all the Dimension and Fact Tables. The person for this role should have experience 5+ years of writing complex SQL Scripts ( Window Level functions, complex CTE, Scripting, Parsing JSONs, joining multiple tables, use surrogate keys join between Dimension and Fact Tables). This person will be using Databricks notebook for testing purposes, familiarity with Databricks environment is a plus but not mandatory. We also would like this person create test cases, alerts and also create some dashboards in Databricks for the team to validate. Setting up Dashboards in Databricks is very simple if the person has familiarity with Tableau or Powerbi should be able to do it quickly. Setting up alerts is also very simple with Databricks. Desired Skills and Experience We are looking for Mid-Level SQL QA Analyst to check and validate Data Warehouse Migration and Replication process to Databricks. We are in Process of Migrating the Datawarehouse from Azure SQL Server to Databricks likewise replicating real time our Transactional Data to Databricks. We are expecting both projects to be completed early next year. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: How you'll make an impact: At Strata we are fueling the missions of lifeblood industries of our society. As a QA engineer on the Financial Institutions team, you will work on financial performance management software that allows financial institutions to plan and forecast for greater efficiency and effectiveness in their operations. You will become an expert in Strata's software and acquire a deep understanding of the technology driving the systems. In addition, you will collaborate with our development and consulting teams to ensure that the product is aligned with client needs and meets Strata's high quality of standards. To be successful in this role you must be passionate about quality assurance, financial planning and analysis, and like working in an agile environment. The following also highlights opportunities: Work on an international agile team following an agile software development process. Use your knowledge of financial planning and analysis and quality assurance methodology to create and execute test cases. Work closely with product management to refine requirements and acceptance criteria and with software development to work through improvements to the software. Identify, troubleshoot, document, and track defects found during testing Perform thorough regression testing on changes in the software Stay up to date on quality assurance, financial planning and analysis, agile process, and IT advancements to assure quality and modernize our systems Leverage AI to create test scripts and test data What we're looking for: 1-2 years of professional experience as a financial analyst at a bank or credit union or equivalent experience Experience with annual budget process, financial analysis, forecasting, or profitability analytics, preferably as these processes apply to financial institutions Experience with financial modeling in Excel Experience with data analysis, data structures and databases Experience leveraging AI in financial analysis Ability to write clear and comprehensive test plans and test cases Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Strong self-motivation, and the ability to work effectively with limited guidance when necessary A drive to learn quickly and constantly adapt to new challenges Excellent written and verbal communication skills Bonus: Experience with software quality assurance methodology and testing of web applications Programming experience Experience with SQL Experience with agile software methodologies like SAFe or Scrum Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle Experience with defect tracking and test management tools such as Microsoft Azure DevOps Estimated Salary Range: $68,000 - $84,000 Actual salary will be determined based on factors including, but not limited to, skill set and level of experience. This salary range is a good faith estimate of base pay. Strata also provides discretionary variable pay programs based on role. In addition, Strata provides a comprehensive benefits package including retirement benefits, health and welfare benefits, paid time off, parental leave, life and accident insurance, and other voluntary and well-being benefits. Find Out More About Strata Benefits Here. How we work: The preferred location for this role is in Chicago, IL or St. Louis, MO. We value our people spending time together and have campuses hosting in-person events located in both cities. We are truly a hybrid environment with all team members experiencing the flexibility to work from home. Thinking about applying? Research shows that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only when they check every box on a job posting. If you're currently reading this and hesitating to click "Apply" for that reason, we encourage you to go for it! A true passion and excitement for making an impact is just as important as work experience. Should you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please reach out to careers@stratadecision.com. Title: Qa Engineer (Third-Party Contractor), Tiktok Global E-Commerce
Description: Responsibilities The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading internet companies. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. Our quality assure engineering team is responsible for keeping an e-commerce ecosystem stable, secure and intuitive for our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join us as we drive the future of e-commerce here at TikTok. What You'll Do: - Responsible for handling international e-commerce feedback tickets, categorizing and labeling bad cases, analyzing tickets, and summarizing common and typical issues. - Follow up on product experience issues, reproduce problems, collaborate with business teams to explore underlying business logic, and drive solutions. - Collect and organize various issues, and generate basic data outputs for daily, weekly, and monthly reports. - Communicate and collaborate with domestic and international teams to resolve issues. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields. - Experience in e-commerce testing, with strong skills in identifying, diagnosing, and driving issue resolution. - Experience in quality operations, with the ability to abstract and summarize common issues from various problems, categorize them, compile data reports, and conduct analysis to produce clear reports. Preferred Qualifications: - Passion for products with strong product awareness, capable of proactively identifying areas for improvement. - Detail-oriented with excellent coordination and communication skills. About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​ Why Join Us Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​ We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​ ​ Diversity & Inclusion​ TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).​ The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​ For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:​ Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. The ideal candidate will be responsible for executing comprehensive testing across the software development lifecycle to ensure product quality and performance. Key Responsibilities Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and departments to align on testing goals Detect, document, and track software defects and inconsistencies Analyze testing results and submit detailed reports to the development team Create test designs, test cases, and maintain test documentation Conduct testing in accordance with defined standards and procedures Ensure consistent execution of testing protocols throughout the software lifecycle Perform testing across all phases: design, development, testing, release, and maintenance Qualifications Proven experience in Android and mobile application testing, including field testing preferred 0-3 years of experience in an Engineering/Testing/Network/Hardware background Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills Effective team player with excellent interpersonal and communication abilities Strong time management and organizational skills Self-motivated and capable of working with minimal supervision Show more Show less

Title: Software Test Engineer
Description: Delta Solutions is seeking a full-time Software Test Engineer at Colorado Springs, CO. What you will be doing: Collaborate with development teams to resolve software defects, participate in troubleshooting and streamline the debugging process. Functional, Regression, Ad-Hoc and Acceptance Testing of custom software. Software integration testing with external software, including PDS-M and MARS Coordinating, scheduling, and leading various software-related events, including demos, operations tests, and inspections. Ensure all stakeholders are aligned, and that events run smoothly, providing necessary documentation, communication, and follow-up to ensure objectives are met. Act as a key point of contact to ensure that these events contribute to overall software quality and stakeholder engagement. Perform root cause analysis on defects found, document causes and solution. Collaborate with external stakeholders to clarify software requirements then turn requirements into test cases and test procedures to verify software meets/exceeds expectations Execute comprehensive testing against the software, ensuring all features function as designed and intended. Contribute to the continuous improvement of software testing methodologies and develop standard operating procedures (SOPs), if necessary. Perform on-site testing, including at Cheyenne Mountain and other operational facilities What You Will Need Clearance: Secret required and ability to obtain TS/SCI Bachelor’s degree (preferred) 3+ years of experience as a software tester or software quality assurance specialist. Proven aptitude for testing quality software on multiple platforms and knowledge of industry-standard operating procedures and tools. Knowledge of computer architecture and tools for manual testing, unit testing, integration testing, functional testing and bug-tracking systems specifically JIRA. Background in missile warning/missile defense and familiarity with ITW/AA related software applications PDS-M and C2BMC. Ability to read and write technical documents Delta Solutions & Strategies offers a generous benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), PTO, paid holidays, parental, military and jury duty paid leaves. In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this position is $90,000-$110,000. Please note the salary information is a general guideline only. Delta Solutions & Strategies considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: Quality Assurance Engineer Salary: $125,000 – $140,000 Location: Irvine, CA (Hybrid/Remote) Position Summary: We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Assurance Engineer to lead the product quality program for our U.S. operations. In this role, you will be a key driver in identifying, triaging, and resolving image quality issues while collaborating with cross-functional teams to improve technical outcomes and customer satisfaction. If you enjoy solving complex problems, working across engineering and operations, and contributing to high-precision imaging products, we’d love to connect with you. Essential Job Functions and Desired Accomplishments • Lead and own the product quality assurance program to ensure alignment with technical and business goals • Investigate and triage image quality anomalies, maintaining thorough documentation for resolution tracking • Perform root cause analysis and assess the business impact of image quality issues • Partner with Engineering and Customer Operations to develop and refine quality-focused initiatives • Define and communicate priorities based on the business impact of quality concerns • Provide technical support and training to internal teams on QA tools and practices • Ensure consistent and accurate execution of quality control procedures • Maintain clear and organized documentation of QA workflows and technical solutions • Promote a culture of continuous improvement across engineering, operations, and support teams • Stay current with new software tools and technologies relevant to quality assurance Education/Qualifications/Certifications Required: Bachelor’s degree in geographic information systems (GIS), an engineering discipline, a related field, or equivalent experience year quality assurance and/or validation experience Ability to work cross-functionally in a highly dynamic environment Basic proficiency with common GIS software (e.g., QGIS, SCOET GXP, etc.) Understanding of image quality analysis and metrics Experience with scripting languages, including Python and Bash Desired: • Knowledge of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imaging and processing • Experience with SAR image quality analysis or exploitation • Familiarity with AWS services such as S3 or EC2 • Experience using Git or similar version control systems • Active TS/SCI clearance or strong interest in pursuing one Show more Show less

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: At Rezilient Health, we're not telehealth and we're not your typical doctor's office — we're the best of both worlds, redefining how primary care is delivered. To make that vision possible, our engineering team builds and maintains the custom tools that power our care model. Our technology is mission-critical, and we take pride in supporting a fast-evolving operation that serves real people with real health needs. As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be the connection between product development and the rest of the organization. You'll work closely with Engineering, Clinical Operations, and Customer Success teams to ensure our product ecosystem is clearly documented, well-understood, and continuously improving. You'll play a central role in maintaining internal knowledge systems, fielding and prioritizing feedback, and helping the team implement product enhancements efficiently and transparently. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of product, process, and people. You are highly organized, proactive, and an excellent communicator. You love building systems that bring structure to complexity. You're energized by the opportunity to wear many hats, take ownership of your work, and help teams function more effectively through process improvement and thoughtful documentation. Requirements Key Responsibilities Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication Act as the primary liaison between the Engineering team and other departments (Clinical, Sales, Operations), ensuring seamless communication on product updates, issues, and feature releases Translate technical concepts and product changes into accessible language and formats for non-technical stakeholders Documentation & Training Develop and maintain comprehensive internal documentation (e.g., FAQs, step-by-step guides, onboarding materials) and training videos for internal teams using our custom software, EMR, and operational tools Create and manage external-facing product documentation and self-help resources (e.g., support articles, video walk-throughs, troubleshooting guides) Draft and publish release notes, product feature summaries, and "what's new" videos to support internal product launches and updates Product Operations & Process Management Implement and maintain streamlined systems for bug tracking, feature suggestion intake, and issue resolution; ensure timely triage and follow-through with the Engineering team Develop workflows and tools to prioritize, define, and route feature requests from across the organization Own and update the internal product feature matrix, including a detailed breakdown of features, user permissions, and access by role type Maintain clinical workflow diagrams in collaboration with the Clinical team, and identify opportunities to optimize processes via technology Quality Assurance & Compliance Coordinate and execute QA testing for new releases, ensuring functionality, usability, and adherence to security and compliance standards Maintain dashboards and documentation pertaining to engineering and IT compliance, including task tracking, remediation status, and audits Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience in Product Operations, Health Tech, or Engineering Support Highly organized, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for process optimization Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, startup environment Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Experience producing clear and engaging content for diverse audiences Comfortable working with minimal structure and shaping new systems from the ground up Familiarity with modern workflow and documentation tools including: Google Workspace, Lucidchart, Miro, Notion, Jira, and Zapier. Experience working in a clinical or health tech environment Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, SOC 2, etc.) Prior experience in QA testing or technical documentation Familiarity with EMR systems or healthcare operations workflows Benefits This opportunity offers the chance to shape the future of healthcare in a culture where your ideas and contributions have a meaningful impact on the organization's future. You'll be part of a supportive, collaborative, and diverse team, with competitive compensation and benefits that include generous PTO, paid family leave, comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, as well as stock options. Show more Show less

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will play a key role in validating the functionality, performance, and usability of our software products. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements, define test strategies, and execute test plans. Your work will help ensure that high-quality, mission-critical healthcare applications are delivered efficiently and with confidence. In this role, you will contribute to manual testing efforts and continuously drive quality throughout the software development lifecycle. You will also serve as a knowledgeable advocate for end-users, actively participating in Agile ceremonies and collaborating with cross-functional teams. What You Will Do Develop, execute, and maintain comprehensive test plans, test cases, test scripts, and related documentation to expand test coverage. Perform various types of testing including functional, regression, integration, exploratory, and smoke testing. Inspect, analyze, and decompose business and functional requirements to ensure clarity, consistency, and testability. Collaborate with developers and product managers to clarify acceptance criteria and identify edge cases early in the development cycle. Monitor and track the resolution of defects, coordinating with engineers to diagnose, report, and resolve issues efficiently. Write and manage test data and configurations across different test environments. Provide product demonstrations and internal training as needed to support release cycles or new features. Actively participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily stand-ups, demos, and retrospectives. Continuously improve QA processes, methodologies, and tools based on best practices and lessons learned. Maintain a deep understanding of product architecture, integrations, and real-world use cases to validate application behavior in production-like conditions. Serve as a champion for product quality, end-user experience, and continuous improvement throughout the organization. Technical Knowledge And Experience Proficiency with test case management tools (e.g., Zephyr, TestRail). Hands-on experience using issue tracking systems (e.g., JIRA, Bugzilla). Working knowledge of databases such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server, including writing SQL queries and procedures. Understanding of web services testing in SOA or microservices environments. Exposure to version control tools (e.g., Bitbucket, Git). Experience testing within a CI/CD pipeline and Agile DevOps workflows. Exposure to public health systems or working in highly regulated industries is a strong plus. Skills And Abilities Highly analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Proactive, self-motivated, and capable of independently driving tasks to completion. Effective communicator with excellent written and verbal skills—comfortable presenting information to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment with changing priorities and competing deadlines. Passionate about quality and user experience; always advocating for the end user. Demonstrated ability to think critically and abstractly when facing complex or ambiguous problems. Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills; comfortable working in cross-functional teams. Eagerness to continuously learn and grow technical and professional skills. Previous leadership or mentoring experience is a plus. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience. 2–5 years of experience in software quality assurance, preferably in a SaaS, healthcare, or enterprise software environment. Relevant QA certifications (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus. Location This position is remote-eligible, however living and working in the local Phoenix, Arizona area is required. About Us When you choose STChealth, you're choosing a small company where your contributions truly matter. You'll be part of a long-standing industry leader with 37 years of experience and the energy and creativity of a start-up. Most importantly, you’ll be joining a mission-driven team committed to reducing the impact of preventable disease and empowering people across the healthcare ecosystem. Recognized as one of Arizona’s Top Workplaces, STChealth is home to a passionate, highly engaged team. We’re inspired by each other and united by a shared purpose: creating intelligent solutions that build healthier communities around the world. Our office, located in Phoenix’s vibrant Warehouse District, features an open layout designed to foster collaboration and creativity — a space where great ideas thrive and forward-thinking solutions take shape. Our benefits are just as exceptional as our mission. We offer a 100% company-paid medical plan, 401(k) matching, paid new parent leave, and a flexible hybrid schedule. Our culture embraces casual dress, dog-friendly office days, and a focus on well-being. We also provide unlimited volunteer hours and a generous amount of paid time off—because we believe in supporting our team both inside and outside of work. Ready to make a difference? Apply today! Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets. Must be a United States citizen or have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Act of 1986. Title: Quality Assurance Tester
Description: Our company is seeking a Quality Assurance Tester (Manual QA) to join our team. The candidate will be part of a team implementing a large, enterprise system for the NYC Department of Education. This role is open to remote candidates, though if possible, those that can come in 2-3 times a week would be ideal. This a contract role, specifically for this project. We are only looking for candidates in the U.S.A and do not offer sponsorship or relocation assistance. Our interview process has 2 rounds. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: At Rezilient Health, we're not telehealth and we're not your typical doctor's office — we're the best of both worlds, redefining how primary care is delivered. To make that vision possible, our engineering team builds and maintains the custom tools that power our care model. Our technology is mission-critical, and we take pride in supporting a fast-evolving operation that serves real people with real health needs. As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be the connection between product development and the rest of the organization. You'll work closely with Engineering, Clinical Operations, and Customer Success teams to ensure our product ecosystem is clearly documented, well-understood, and continuously improving. You'll play a central role in maintaining internal knowledge systems, fielding and prioritizing feedback, and helping the team implement product enhancements efficiently and transparently. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of product, process, and people. You are highly organized, proactive, and an excellent communicator. You love building systems that bring structure to complexity. You're energized by the opportunity to wear many hats, take ownership of your work, and help teams function more effectively through process improvement and thoughtful documentation. Requirements Key Responsibilities Cross-Functional Collaboration & Communication Act as the primary liaison between the Engineering team and other departments (Clinical, Sales, Operations), ensuring seamless communication on product updates, issues, and feature releases Translate technical concepts and product changes into accessible language and formats for non-technical stakeholders Documentation & Training Develop and maintain comprehensive internal documentation (e.g., FAQs, step-by-step guides, onboarding materials) and training videos for internal teams using our custom software, EMR, and operational tools Create and manage external-facing product documentation and self-help resources (e.g., support articles, video walk-throughs, troubleshooting guides) Draft and publish release notes, product feature summaries, and "what's new" videos to support internal product launches and updates Product Operations & Process Management Implement and maintain streamlined systems for bug tracking, feature suggestion intake, and issue resolution; ensure timely triage and follow-through with the Engineering team Develop workflows and tools to prioritize, define, and route feature requests from across the organization Own and update the internal product feature matrix, including a detailed breakdown of features, user permissions, and access by role type Maintain clinical workflow diagrams in collaboration with the Clinical team, and identify opportunities to optimize processes via technology Quality Assurance & Compliance Coordinate and execute QA testing for new releases, ensuring functionality, usability, and adherence to security and compliance standards Maintain dashboards and documentation pertaining to engineering and IT compliance, including task tracking, remediation status, and audits Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience in Product Operations, Health Tech, or Engineering Support Highly organized, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for process optimization Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, startup environment Strong communication skills, both written and verbal Experience producing clear and engaging content for diverse audiences Comfortable working with minimal structure and shaping new systems from the ground up Familiarity with modern workflow and documentation tools including: Google Workspace, Lucidchart, Miro, Notion, Jira, and Zapier. Experience working in a clinical or health tech environment Knowledge of security and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, SOC 2, etc.) Prior experience in QA testing or technical documentation Familiarity with EMR systems or healthcare operations workflows Benefits This opportunity offers the chance to shape the future of healthcare in a culture where your ideas and contributions have a meaningful impact on the organization's future. You'll be part of a supportive, collaborative, and diverse team, with competitive compensation and benefits that include generous PTO, paid family leave, comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, as well as stock options. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will play a key role in validating the functionality, performance, and usability of our software products. You will work closely with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders to understand requirements, define test strategies, and execute test plans. Your work will help ensure that high-quality, mission-critical healthcare applications are delivered efficiently and with confidence. In this role, you will contribute to manual testing efforts and continuously drive quality throughout the software development lifecycle. You will also serve as a knowledgeable advocate for end-users, actively participating in Agile ceremonies and collaborating with cross-functional teams. What You Will Do Develop, execute, and maintain comprehensive test plans, test cases, test scripts, and related documentation to expand test coverage. Perform various types of testing including functional, regression, integration, exploratory, and smoke testing. Inspect, analyze, and decompose business and functional requirements to ensure clarity, consistency, and testability. Collaborate with developers and product managers to clarify acceptance criteria and identify edge cases early in the development cycle. Monitor and track the resolution of defects, coordinating with engineers to diagnose, report, and resolve issues efficiently. Write and manage test data and configurations across different test environments. Provide product demonstrations and internal training as needed to support release cycles or new features. Actively participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily stand-ups, demos, and retrospectives. Continuously improve QA processes, methodologies, and tools based on best practices and lessons learned. Maintain a deep understanding of product architecture, integrations, and real-world use cases to validate application behavior in production-like conditions. Serve as a champion for product quality, end-user experience, and continuous improvement throughout the organization. Technical Knowledge And Experience Proficiency with test case management tools (e.g., Zephyr, TestRail). Hands-on experience using issue tracking systems (e.g., JIRA, Bugzilla). Working knowledge of databases such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server, including writing SQL queries and procedures. Understanding of web services testing in SOA or microservices environments. Exposure to version control tools (e.g., Bitbucket, Git). Experience testing within a CI/CD pipeline and Agile DevOps workflows. Exposure to public health systems or working in highly regulated industries is a strong plus. Skills And Abilities Highly analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Proactive, self-motivated, and capable of independently driving tasks to completion. Effective communicator with excellent written and verbal skills—comfortable presenting information to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving environment with changing priorities and competing deadlines. Passionate about quality and user experience; always advocating for the end user. Demonstrated ability to think critically and abstractly when facing complex or ambiguous problems. Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills; comfortable working in cross-functional teams. Eagerness to continuously learn and grow technical and professional skills. Previous leadership or mentoring experience is a plus. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience. 2–5 years of experience in software quality assurance, preferably in a SaaS, healthcare, or enterprise software environment. Relevant QA certifications (e.g., ISTQB, CSTE) are a plus. Location This position is remote-eligible, however living and working in the local Phoenix, Arizona area is required. About Us When you choose STChealth, you're choosing a small company where your contributions truly matter. You'll be part of a long-standing industry leader with 37 years of experience and the energy and creativity of a start-up. Most importantly, you’ll be joining a mission-driven team committed to reducing the impact of preventable disease and empowering people across the healthcare ecosystem. Recognized as one of Arizona’s Top Workplaces, STChealth is home to a passionate, highly engaged team. We’re inspired by each other and united by a shared purpose: creating intelligent solutions that build healthier communities around the world. Our office, located in Phoenix’s vibrant Warehouse District, features an open layout designed to foster collaboration and creativity — a space where great ideas thrive and forward-thinking solutions take shape. Our benefits are just as exceptional as our mission. We offer a 100% company-paid medical plan, 401(k) matching, paid new parent leave, and a flexible hybrid schedule. Our culture embraces casual dress, dog-friendly office days, and a focus on well-being. We also provide unlimited volunteer hours and a generous amount of paid time off—because we believe in supporting our team both inside and outside of work. Ready to make a difference? Apply today! Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets. Must be a United States citizen or have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Act of 1986. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: We, Alibaba Overseas Engineering & TPM team, are seeking for a highly skilled and experienced Construction Quality Assurance Expert/On-site Testing & Commissioning Supervisor to join our dynamic and innovative team. Our team is dedicated to the design, construction, testing & commissioning and optimization of public cloud infrastructure and facilities. This multidisciplinary group combines expertise in electrical, mechanical and civil engineering, construction progress management, construction quality management to ensure delivery of high-performance environments that support critical IT equipment needs. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the successful testing and commissioning of our electrical and mechanical facilities, with a focus on spending at least 30% of your working time on construction sites. You will be accountable for the following key responsibilities, 1. Site Supervision and Coordination 2. Facility Testing and Commissioning 3. Documentation and Reporting 4. Compliance and Quality Assurance 5. Escalation and Stakeholder Engagement Minimum qualification: - A minimum of 5 years of proven experience in facility testing and commissioning, with a strong track record of successful construction project delivery. - Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to present technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences. - Proficiency in developing and executing comprehensive testing and commissioning plans, as well as interpreting and documenting test results. - Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or a related field) Preferred qualification: - Extensive knowledge of electrical and mechanical infrastructure, including but not limited to power, cooling, ventilation, fire-fighting, plumbing, drainage and monitoring. - Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues. - Strong project management and coordination skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams. - Master's degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical or a related field) - Professional engineer (PE) is preferred. Title: Qa Engineer
Description: Job Overview: Are you ready to shape the future of healthcare? At Laerdal Labs D.C., we’re on a mission to help save lives through cutting-edge software solutions. Our SimCapture Cloud product is trusted by over 2000 top hospitals, medical schools, and nursing programs worldwide—so everything we build (and test!) makes a real difference. Now, we’re looking for a detail-driven, tech-savvy Software Quality Assurance Engineer to join our fun and fast-paced team! At a Glance: In this hybrid role, you’ll be in the office twice a week (Tuesdays & Thursdays) and working from home the rest of the time. You’ll collaborate closely with fellow QA Engineers and Software Developers to ensure our application is stable, user-friendly, and bug-free. From crafting thorough test plans to troubleshooting and validating audiovisual hardware and Windows drivers, you’ll face new challenges daily—all while making a meaningful impact on healthcare education across the globe. What You’ll Do: Test & Triumph: Validate software features, fixes, and performance through functional, smoke, end-to-end, and regression testing. Bug Buster: Investigate and document software failures, then collaborate with developers to root out the culprit and track down solutions. Hardware Hero: Install, troubleshoot, and test audiovisual equipment, cameras, servers, and drivers on Windows—ensuring our cutting-edge solutions perform flawlessly. Escalation Expert: Assist teams like Development, Implementation, Sales, and Tech Support by digging into escalated issues, identifying workarounds, and documenting everything for smooth resolution. Data Detective: Gather key info from log files, databases, and configuration files to fully understand and fix issues. Innovation Influencer: Brainstorm improvements that enhance usability and stability. Share your input on features and fixes that make our applications shine. QA Conductor: Collaborate with your fellow QA pros to refine our testing strategy, develop new test cases, and coordinate test rack management. What We’re Looking For: Technical Chops: 2+ years of experience in QA, development, engineering, or product support. You’re familiar with cloud-based applications (AWS, databases, browsers) and comfortable working in Windows. Hardware Know-How: You can roll up your sleeves and set up AV equipment, cameras, servers—whatever it takes to keep everything running smoothly. Testing Mastery: You know how to build detailed test plans, identify bugs, and ensure continuous quality through regression testing. Agile Attitude: You thrive in a dynamic environment, love juggling multiple tasks, and keep a sharp eye on every detail. Stellar Communication: You can clearly document issues, share solutions, and collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Eager Learner: A bachelor’s degree in IT or engineering (or equivalent experience) means you have a solid foundation, and you’re always ready to pick up new skills. Bonus Points: Experience with JavaScript, Linux, or macOS is a plus—but not required! Why Join Us? Impactful Work: Every test you run helps make healthcare training better and saves lives. Collaborative Culture: Work side by side with passionate teammates who value creativity, problem-solving, and a healthy dose of fun. Professional Growth: Step into a role that offers endless opportunities to expand your QA toolkit and test new horizons in software quality assurance. Flexibility: Enjoy a hybrid schedule that blends office camaraderie with the convenience of remote work. Ready to team up and make a tangible difference in healthcare education? Apply now and become an essential part of our journey to empower medical professionals around the globe! Show more Show less

If you enjoy solving complex problems, working across engineering and operations, and contributing to high-precision imaging products, we’d love to connect with you. Essential Job Functions and Desired Accomplishments • Lead and own the product quality assurance program to ensure alignment with technical and business goals • Investigate and triage image quality anomalies, maintaining thorough documentation for resolution tracking • Perform root cause analysis and assess the business impact of image quality issues • Partner with Engineering and Customer Operations to develop and refine quality-focused initiatives • Define and communicate priorities based on the business impact of quality concerns • Provide technical support and training to internal teams on QA tools and practices • Ensure consistent and accurate execution of quality control procedures • Maintain clear and organized documentation of QA workflows and technical solutions • Promote a culture of continuous improvement across engineering, operations, and support teams • Stay current with new software tools and technologies relevant to quality assurance Education/Qualifications/Certifications Required: Bachelor’s degree in geographic information systems (GIS), an engineering discipline, a related field, or equivalent experience year quality assurance and/or validation experience Ability to work cross-functionally in a highly dynamic environment Basic proficiency with common GIS software (e.g., QGIS, SCOET GXP, etc.) Understanding of image quality analysis and metrics Experience with scripting languages, including Python and Bash Desired: • Knowledge of Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) imaging and processing • Experience with SAR image quality analysis or exploitation • Familiarity with AWS services such as S3 or EC2 • Experience using Git or similar version control systems • Active TS/SCI clearance or strong interest in pursuing one Show more Show less

Title: Qa Engineer I
Description: Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Olympus Corporation of the Americas. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice. Working Location: CALIFORNIA, SAN JOSE Workplace Flexibility: Onsite For more than 100 years, Olympus has focused on making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling. Every day, we live by our philosophy, True to Life, by advancing medical technologies and elevating the standard of patient care so people everywhere can fulfill their desires, dreams, and lives. Our five Core Values empower us to achieve Our Purpose: Patient Focus, Integrity, Innovation, Impact and Empathy. Learn more about Life at Olympus (https://www.olympusamerica.com/careers) . Job Description The Quality Assurance Engineer I is responsible for providing Quality Engineering input to support Production, Operations and Engineering activities. Maintains and follows Quality Engineering methodologies, systems, and practices which meet Olympus, customer, and regulatory requirements. Serves as a Quality representative to improve awareness, visibility and communication on Quality initiatives to support departmental, functional, site, divisional and corporate Quality goals and priorities. When needed, works with Olympus Toyko representatives/liaisons to resolve Quality related issues. Job Duties Provide Quality Engineering support on projects to implement new product introduction or alternate repair activities. Train Technicians, Supervisors and other employees on the use of new products or processes. Perform packaging and equipment validations and other verifications/validations to support new product or new repair introductions. Provide technical guidance to the Change Control Board; educate members on technical issues associated with assigned projects. Support continues improvement measures by providing technical information and reviewing processes as they are revised. Address or initiate Engineering Change Orders (COs) in a timely manner to maintain project schedules and/or achieve acceptable levels of compliance. Supports problem solving activities to resolve Quality issues. Support and/or drive corrections and corrective actions to resolve non-conformances (DMNs, NCRs, CAPAs and ADT) with minimal guidance. Communicate significant issues or developments identified during Quality assurance activities and support process improvements identified by cross-functional teams (CFTs) and management. Analyze Production and Complaint data and identify significant trends. Manage calibration and metrology activities needed to support Production. Work with the calibration bendor to develop a routine calibration schedule. Coordinate emergency calibrations and complete Out of Tolerance reports as needed. Support the Quality Management System (QMS) by performing periodic product, process, and internal audits. Support and participate in external audits as needed. Work with Operations to resolve material issues. Work directly with the OEM to resolve Quality problems identified through complaint investigations and/or other sources of Quality data. Perform all other related duties as assigned. Required Job Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Scientific Discipline (or equivalent) with 0-2 years experience of Engineering or related experience. Working knowledge of metrology and typical metrology instruments including calipers, micrometers, snap gages, etc. Effective written and verbal communication skills. Able to communicate clearly. Must be able to work effectively cross-functionally. Basic understanding of mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference as well as perform basic mathematical calculations. Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule work assignments with supervision. Ability to solve practical problems. Ability to complete project tasks and assignments in a timely manner. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Preferred Working knowledge of Datasweep, Adwatch, SAP and JDE preferred. Working knowledge of AutoCAD and/or SolidWorks preferred. Basic understanding of ISO 13485 and FDA Regulations preferred. Basic understanding of 5S and other forms of waste in the Production environment preferred. Basic understanding of good manufacturing practices preferred. Why join Olympus? We offer a holistic employee experience supporting personal and professional well-being through meaningful work, equitable offerings, and a connected culture. Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description: Job title: QA Engineer Location: Arlington, VA We are seeking a talented and highly motivated Quality Assurance Engineer (QAE) for a contract position. The ideal candidate has great communication skills, can remove roadblocks, detail oriented, and has a knack for breaking websites. QAE's regularly work with Developers, Product Managers and other Quality Engineers to ensure the proper operation of the production environment. During the development cycle, QAEs identify use cases, create test cases, execute tests, and report results. Qualifications: BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience 4+ years industry experience testing software, including website applications. Experience with HTML, JavaScript, Java and SQL is desired, but not required. Experience with Selenium highly desired # Strong verbal and written communication skills are essential. Proficiency working in a Linux/Unix environment. Experience with QA process and Software Development Life Cycle. Additional Skills Required: JSON, Testrail, AWS fundamentals, Plan and write test cases, system and domain knowledge acquisition, stakeholder communication, project management, SQL Surrounding Team and Key Projects: QA’s hired will support OE2026 by planning and executing end to end testing of the BXT systems. Will also support the end to end testing program, which centralizes the DevOps workstreams under one team for the organization. Typical Task Breakdown: During the development cycle, QAEs identify use cases, create test cases, execute tests, and report results. Show more Show less
